snippet: The Saudi-led military campaign in Yemen, combined with fierce fighting on the ground, has displaced an estimated 300,000 people and destroyed vital infrastructure.
abstract: Saudi-led bombing campaign in Yemen has claimed lives of more than 1,000 people and left at least 300,000 homeless and scrambling for shelter and food; Saudis have intensified air campaign against Houthi rebels despite pledge to scale it back; humanitarian crisis and deepening civil war have raised questions about strategic goals of conflict in which neither side appears to be nearing victory.

byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen, and Saeed Al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: The Saudi-led military campaign in Yemen, combined with fierce fighting on the ground, has displaced an estimated 300,000 people and destroyed vital infrastructure.

headline.main: Yemenis in Desperate Need of Food and Fuel After Weeks of Airstrikes
headline.print_headline: Saudi-Led Strikes Hit Yemeni Civilians Hard
